stories.text:
I’ve long been in the mindest of gutting it out through the long emergency until things get better. But now that so many people are excited about remote work, it seems like back-to-back Zoom meetings all day will remain the central experience of “having a white-collar job” until I’m able to retire. The days I spend collaborating with remote workers leave me in pretty bad shape by the time the last call disconnects. I find I’m not able to relax and enjoy the evening, or to transition into being productive on anything else (work or personal). I just feel like shit.

It seems many people on HN actually love this kind of life. Do you feel similar effects? How do you manage them?
stories.title: Ask HN: How are you coping with wall to wall Zoom meetings?
Three arrested in London over unofficial Club Penguin site

stories.text:
I finally bought a new MacBook Pro 14” M1 Pro a few days ago.

I come from Linux background and have been using mostly Arch Linux with i3. Any tips on how setting up my macbook as a developer machine would be appreciated.

Right now I’ve installed Home-brew and iTerm2 so you might be pretty sure that I’m going into that UNIX side of Apple, but I’m still eager to discover wonders of that “creative” or even “regular day to day usage” parts.

Any recommendations on software or even sharing dotfiles as examples would be highly appreciated :)
stories.title: Ask HN: What should I do after getting my first new MacBook?
